taxonomicnotes: It is commonly known as Chhota Kumbhi or Water Lettuce.
rationale: This aquatic plant is widespread and common from Africa to southeast Asia. It has also been recorded in Mexico, central America, the Caribbean islands and South America. It is a free-floating plant that occurs in lakes, ponds, rivers and other water bodies. Water Lettuce is used in China as animal food and for medicinal purpose. It also has ornamental use as an aquarium plant. As no major threats have been reported the species is listed as Least Concern.
evaluator: Juffe Bignoli, D., Bounphanmy, S. & Homsombath, K.
